result.execSummary:
The defendant Micheal J Gilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Micheal J Gilson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Micheal J Gilson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges subject to jail policies. May transfer to Dane County,  10-18-22 Judge Cross imposed loss of huber privileges.
Consecutive to: Any other charges.

2:25 PM Defendant Micheal J Gilson in court, in custody.  Attorney Jonathan Ross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Micheal J Gilson.  ADA Ross orally amended charge to misd possession of THC.  Amended complaint to be filed.  Rights/elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct 1.  Court accepted plea/adjudged guilty/JOC entered.  Ct 2 dismissed.  Sentencing statements.  Court imposed 45 days jail commencing 10-14-2022 @ 7pm.  May transfer to Dane County.   Fine $443.00 due 60 days or payplan.  5 days jail credit.  Warrant canceled.

1:46 pm ADA Jonathan Ross appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in custody by video.  Atty Allison Borsheim, special appearance by video. Defendant missed plea date of 8-1-22.  Atty Borsheim stated defendant thought it was 8-8-22.  Matter is resolved.  Matter may be held today at 3:30 or tomorrow at 8:45 am.  Security to transport if possible.  Warrant is reinstated.

ADA Jonathan Ross appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Gilson appeared by video in custody. Attorney Allison Borsheim, special appearance.   Court referred matter to Br 3 as there has been a substitution has been filed.
